items.title: Live: Trump doubles down on oil plans for Venezuela, floats US operation in Colombia
items.description: It comes as US Secretary of State Marco Rubio says discussions of Venezuela holding elections following Nicolás Maduro's ouster are "premature", with Washington focused on ensuring Caracas now carries out policy changes.

items.title: 'Completely false': Trump's claims about stolen oil refuted
items.description: US President Donald Trump has said Venezuela stole United States oil assets. The truth experts say is much more complex than that.

items.title: Inside the 'disgusting' jail where Nicolás Maduro has joined high-profile inmates
items.description: The facility where detained Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has been taken is a notorious New York jail that has held a string of high-profile and celebrity criminals, from drug cartel leaders to hip-hop stars.

items.title: Trump gambles on MAGA base backing his new imperialism
items.description: Donald Trump has long defied political gravity but whether his followers in Congress and the MAGA movement will follow him into a new colonialism is a big gamble.

items.title: Denmark tells Trump to stop Greenland 'threats'
items.description: The leaders of Denmark and Greenland have urged US President Donald Trump to stop threatening to take over Greenland.

items.title: How a 'ruthless' energy company went after a pensioner for money he didn't owe
items.description: Australia's energy prices continue to soar as questions continue to be raised about the actions of providers, including by this pensioner who was overcharged and then had debt collectors chasing him.

items.title: States brace for 'worst' heatwave since Black Summer
items.description: Blisteringly high temperatures are expected throughout Victoria and in parts of South Australia and New South Wales.

items.title: Prison escapee attacks Victorian farm worker
items.description: A farm worker says he was threatened by a man who escaped from Langi Kal Kal prison near Ballarat.

items.title: Batting class prevails for Head and Root on a fiery day in Sydney
items.description: In what has been a bowlers' series, the class of Joe Root and Travis Head again shone on day two in Sydney, where it often took something silly for a wicket to fall.

items.title: Measles alert as Adelaide and Sydney airports among possible exposure sites
items.description: SA and NSW health authorities have issued alerts about a potential measles exposure risk, after a person with the disease recently caught a flight from Adelaide to Sydney.

items.title: Bondi Beach gunman moved to Goulburn Supermax prison
items.description: The ABC understands Naveed Akram was moved earlier on Monday from Sydney's Long Bay jail hospital where he has been for the past fortnight.

items.title: Queensland government unveils plans for Olympic stadium
items.description: The new stadium will host the opening and closing ceremonies and athletics at the 2032 Games, before becoming the city’s main stadium with 63,000 seats.

items.title: Bureau forecasts moderate chance of cyclone hitting Far North Queensland coast
items.description: The chance of a tropical low off the Far North Queensland coast developing into a cyclone is increasing from low to moderate by the weekend, according to the weather bureau.

items.title: Police employee faces court over alleged antisemitic online posts
items.description: Muamer Nukic, a 50-year-old Queensland Police Service employee and described as a "self-proclaimed anti-Zionist" was granted bail in the Brisbane Magistrate Court on Monday.

items.title: All victims of Swiss ski resort bar fire now identified
items.description: Swiss police say more than half of the 40 people killed after a fire broke out at a bar in the Crans-Montana resort were teenagers.

items.title: Jacob Elordi and Sarah Snook win at Critics Choice Awards
items.description: Australia's Sarah Snook takes out Best Actress in a Limited Series or Movie Made for Television with All Her Fault, while Jacob Elordi wins Best Supporting Actor for his performance in Frankenstein.

items.title: Cause of woman's death in custody still 'undetermined' after autopsy
items.description: Police say the cause of a woman's death in a Northern Territory police watch house last month remains "undetermined" following a post-mortem examination conducted on Friday.

items.title: 'We want to get that money back to you': $300m of unclaimed cash in NSW
items.description: Almost $300 million in refunds, dividends and cheques remain unclaimed by households and businesses across New South Wales, with locals urged to take action to secure the money they are owed.

items.title: The island in Japan 'whose name cannot be spoken'
items.description: Boasting thousands of years of history and a World Heritage listing, Okinoshima is Japan's very own treasure island. It's also completely off limits to women.

items.title: League president reported to AFL over 'gender weirdness' alleged comments
items.description: A country football league president has been reported to the AFL Integrity Unit over alleged comments about a club's "grooming and gender weirdness" after it was involved in blocking the club from entering a neighbouring competition.

items.title: Djokovic quits players body he co-founded over transparency concerns
items.description: Novak Djokovic is stepping away from the Professional Tennis Players Association citing concerns over transparency and governance within the organisation.

items.title: The Australian dollar is at a critical crossroads. Which way will it go?
items.description: The value of Australia's currency could move significantly up or down depending on the direction of interest rates. But the global economic backdrop will also be crucial in determining its direction.

items.title: Police investigate burglary at offices of comedy troupe Sooshi Mango
items.description: The group posted CCTV footage on social media appearing to show a man breaking into an office in Carlton.

items.title: Katherine may have 700 half-siblings. She's trying to find them to pass on medical advice
items.description: Hundreds of people have accessed South Australia's Donor Conception Register in its first year, lifting decades of secrecy surrounding anonymous donations — an outcome that has prompted calls from a leading advocate for similar moves at national level.

items.title: Suspension lifted for chief medical officer after 14-month wait
items.description: Mackay's chief medical officer, Charles Pain, returns to work after an external investigation cleared him of allegations of poor clinical governance.
